posts.post_content:
@Luke9389  
  
Sorry it doesn't work that way. When it ever an ability says "When CARDNAME enters the battlefield" CARDNAME will always be referring to itself and not another creature with the same name.  
  
This is how a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) goes:  
First casting Archon of Redemption gives you 3 life since it counts itself.  
Then hopefully next turn (unless you have access to 14 mana. You cast a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) targeting Archon of Redemption which gives you 5 copies of the Archon.  
Then all abilities are put into the stack.  
You gain 3 life (Archon's Power) times 6 (Number of Archon's) which is 18 for each Archon that entered the battlefield this turn (5 copies)  
This mean you gain 18 life per copy of Archon which came into play with rite (5)  
This would gain you a total of 90 life not 150 not counting the 3 life from the original Archon of Redemption.  
  
At this point you'd have a really big grin on your face especially if you have a autoca... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

This mean you gain 18 life per copy of Archon which came into play with rite (5)
This would gain you a total of 90 life not 150 not counting the 3 life from the original Archon of Redemption.

Posted By: Paleopaladin (5/2/2012 1:09:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It can't just be thrown into any white deck, since there is a lot of good competition for the 5 mana slot. Gaining a few life is not worth the relatively lax power of this creature. [Guardian Seraph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guardian Seraph) will outperform this most of the time.   
  
You can build W/R attrition decks that like this though.   
You will only take a net 2 damage when casting this through a [manabarbs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=manabarbs), and the second one would net you a life. And you will gain a net 1 life in any turn in which there is only one [spiteful vissions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spiteful vissions) out. When all the players are racing the clock, getting an evasive attacker and good blocker that cushions your life can be the winning card.   
  
If you can get out a [flickerwisp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=flickerwisp), and then play a second and have them endlessly cycle each other, then you could gain 3 life at the end of everyone's turn, but even that it kinda lame.
posts.html:
It can't just be thrown into any white deck, since there is a lot of good competition for the 5 mana slot. Gaining a few life is not worth the relatively lax power of this creature. Guardian Seraph will outperform this most of the time.

You can build W/R attrition decks that like this though.
You will only take a net 2 damage when casting this through a manabarbs, and the second one would net you a life. And you will gain a net 1 life in any turn in which there is only one spiteful vissions out. When all the players are racing the clock, getting an evasive attacker and good blocker that cushions your life can be the winning card.

If you can get out a flickerwisp, and then play a second and have them endlessly cycle each other, then you could gain 3 life at the end of everyone's turn, but even that it kinda lame.
